CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 6-3-d;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody by the officers from ORG branch on suspicion of aiding and abetting an illegal terrorist organisation , the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the judge at ORG . Before the court she pleaded not guilty and maintained that she did not accept the statements that she had made at ORG . She further denied the testimony of a witness , PERSON , against her . Subsequently , the court ordered her release on account of insufficient evidence to remand her in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed an indictment with the court charging the applicant under LAW of LAW and LAW no . ORG ( the Prevention of Terrorism Act DATE as amended ) with aiding and abetting the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced her to DATE and DATE imprisonment . She was further debarred from public service for DATE . The court based its judgment on the following evidence : some ammunition found by the police , various weapons and the ballistics reports confirming the applicant 's use thereof , invoices , a notebook used for recording expenditures of the ORG , photos of the applicant taken with some ORG militants , the statements made by the applicant at ORG , the statements made by ORG , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON at ORG , ORG office and before the court and finally the testimonies of ORG , ORG , ORG , GPE and ORG , who were being tried by the same court for charges with other offences .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE chief public prosecutor suspended the execution of the applicant 's sentence until DATE as she had given birth .

CARDINAL . The ORG refers to the overview of the domestic law derived from previous submissions in other cases , in particular PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . MONEY , § § DATE , DATE ) .
